title: Can Liandrys get split in 2 items plis?
body:
AP + HP is fine, then you have flat magic pen = good for assassins/burst mages against squishies. 
But then there is also a %hp dot that gets stronger if the target is CCd = good for control mages against tanks.

You could make one build out of {{item:3136}} +{{item:3113}} + {{item:1052}} (7-10% move speed, 15 or 20 magic pen, AP and HP) for burst champs.

And one out of {{item:1026}} / {{item:1058}}  + {{item:3067}} + {{item:1052}} (Liandrys passive, 10% cdr to apply it more often, AP and HP) for control/poke/dot mages vs tanks.

Being niche doesn't make an item bad.

AP itemization in general has a ton of items that could easily be split into several. Liandry's is one of them, and on top of that I think Haunting Guise really needs at least one more upgrade, as currently it railroads players into building just one single item. AP assassins and fighters need to start having their own itemization, distinct from mage items, and I think Liandry's could be a good start to work towards updating magic pen and AP + health combinations.

dps is always gonna be effective against squishy's because they're weak to all dmg.

Liandry's doesn't even specifically bring burst. I've never seen the only reason ppl would build it on burst mages is because there's no better mpen alternative for them.

Splitting it in 2 items is the same as removing it in favour of burst mages. The ones who like the item right now will have no access or very limited access to Mpen. Adding an alternative gives everyone what they want.
Yes but liandry's has flat pen for anti squishy specifically and the passive for anti tank specifically. It doesn't need both.

The only reason the burn is % hp dmg is so it works on tanks but isn't ridiculous against squishy's. 

While % damage is better against tanks it isn't always meant to be used specifically against them, it also functions as a balancing option to keep damage against squishy's in check while still having meaningfull damage against tanks.

imagine it doing 60 flat damage (that's 2% of 3000 fyi) /s for 3 sec. that would be 180 dmg to an adc with about 1.8k hp. so that's 10% of their health gone .
Now against the tank with 3k hp that would be 6% not taking resistances in account.
However if it's in % the adc only takes 36 dmg/s for 3 sec (108 dmg).

Splitting it would mean Burst mages get their mpen item but DoT mages would have to build 2 items, especially for the tankier ones like Singed this would be an issue as they are limited to 1-3 damage items depending on champ/elo.

the reason liandrys came to existence with those absurd stats was because there was once upon a time when tanks stacked HP and no resistance.
